intro: Juncoides campestris, commonly known as the field rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Juncaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like, cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in meadows and along the edges of water bodies. Juncoides campestris plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
